intro: Corunastylis bishopii, commonly known as Bishop's corunastylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in heathland or dry forest habitats. It is a perennial herb that grows close to the ground, with a fibrous root system. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
